reviews.text: Some of the staff are rude, especially when you try to walk in without a ticket. Missed my train a couple of times because of this. Why do train conductors sell tickets if they're gonna be so overzealous like this at the station? Other staff are totally clueless and not even knowing where the destinations are. The place is always dirty and damp downstairs aswell.

Its a nice station with a heated waiting room and a little snack shop.  Plenty of bus connections and lots of nearby shops etc.  The station has its own carpark and getting into the town centre usually isn't a problem.  Trains are pretty frequent and there is a handy display at the top of the stairs which will tell you which platform the next Glasgow bound train will arrive on.

A lovely station in Paisley's town centre! It's like a mini Glasgow Central. There's a lovely glass roof and the facade is nice, almost like a castle. It's even got it's own Heilanman's umbrella (a bit of the station going over the road)

Very busy train station at peak times but staff generally helpful. Very limited parking space nearby but is very near to buses. Is manned but also with ticket machines and has lift access for prams, wheelchairs and bicycles. Toilet facilities and waiting rooms for customers available.
Christmas markets well worth the visit
